  • Constructor Details

    • ClientHandler

      public ClientHandler​(java.net.Socket s, java.lang.String name, java.io.ObjectOutputStream oos, LevelData lvlGen, java.net.DatagramSocket socket4435, java.net.DatagramSocket socket4437)
      Constructor. There is one ClientHandler per player running on the server.
      Parameters:
      s - The Socket
      name - The name of the client e.g. player1
      oos - ObjectsOutputStream that sends output to the client
      lvlGen - The level generating
      socket4435 - The socket of player one
      socket4437 - The socket of player two

  • Method Details

    • sendLevel

      private java.lang.String sendLevel​(java.io.ObjectOutputStream oos)
      Sends the level using the provided object output stream.
      Parameters:
      oos - Object output stream to send the level on.
      Returns:
      "Success" or "Failure"

    • createDatagramSocket

      private java.net.DatagramSocket createDatagramSocket()
      Creates a UDP datagram socket. Tries 5 times in case it fails. As part of defensive programming.
      Returns:
      a new DatagramSocket

    • intToByteArray

      public static byte[] intToByteArray​(int value)
      Converts an int to a byte array.
      Parameters:
      value - - The int to convert.
      Returns:
      The byte array

    • serverLoop

      private void serverLoop​(java.net.DatagramSocket sendFrom, int sendIntPort)
      The main server loop.
      Parameters:
      sendFrom - - The port sent from.
      sendIntPort - - The port number to send to.

    • organisePorts

      private java.lang.String organisePorts​(java.io.ObjectOutputStream oos, java.lang.String name)
      Communicates through TCP to organise the UDP ports before the game starts.
      Parameters:
      oos - - TCP object output stream already set up
      name - - The name of the client.
      Returns:
      "Success" or "failure"

    • changeLvl

      private static void changeLvl()
      Changes the level in the clientHandler

    • run

      public void run()
      Organises ports, sends the level and then starts the server loop.
      Specified by:
      run in interface java.lang.Runnable
